multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been increasingly forgetful over the past two years, especially misplacing items, forgetting names and numbers, and not remembering what I watched or read the day before.
How old are you?
I am 73 years old.
Do you have any difficulties with daily activities or personal care?
Yes, I stopped going for my daily walks because I got lost once on my way back home, and I'm no longer allowed to cook because I've left the gas stove on after making meals.
Have you noticed any changes in your mood or behavior?
I become agitated when asked questions directly.
Do you have any family history of dementia or Alzheimer's disease?
I'm just a patient describing my own symptoms and don't have information about my family's medical history.
Are you currently taking any medications for your symptoms?
I am not taking any specific medications for these symptoms, but I am on medications for other conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Alzheimer's disease.
